@kalena Actually I don't that's the only point where we differ.
@ronindotca Not me. That's where we differ.
@elpie @ThisCJ @kalena again, I think there is a difference between "I got it from my grandma" and hunting one down.

@elpie Wow. Did you ever consider getting rid of it? @kalena @ronindotca

@kalena @ThisCJ but it's wrapped up with lots of other meaning. For many many people.

@ronindotca My point. @kalena
@ThisCJ @kalena isn't that what we all do?
@kalena I'm judging him against my values, yes. @ronindotca
@kalena @ThisCJ ...radio broadcasts from Rwanda. I'm saying the copy, signed by Hitler, given to a guy who was there when it was ...
@kalena @ThisCJ ...formulated is not without further meaning than "a book". to pretend otherwise is disgusting.
@kalena @ThisCJ and to feign surprise that people might think that is idiotic.
@ThisCJ @ronindotca I see now. But u don't think you are projecting your values on to someone who may just be an avid collector, not a fan?
@kalena I agree. You can probably d/l a PDF. I just think it's beyond poor to own a signed copy - makes it like any other book. @ronindotca
@kalena @ThisCJ a completely meaningless 'symbol' of authoritarianism, is being used to smear the ONLY anti-authoritarianista in NZ politics
@kalena @ThisCJ With apologies to Hone of course. The damning thing about this isn't to do with Kim, it's the people being sucked in by it.
@ThisCJ @ronindotca ...makes Mein Kampf required reading, if only to avoid a repeat of such individual influence in future.

@ThisCJ @ronindotca It's both a fascinating and horrific historical period and we need to learn from it. It's rare to have a blueprint...

@saniac @kalena @ikostar ...unthinking, tone deaf, goof with poor judgement".
@saniac @kalena Ah. It has magical powers then.
@kalena It's not just "a historical artifact" to me. @ikostar
@saniac Again, why? Just because you find an historical artefact neat, doesn't make you a criminal, or suspicious in any way @ikostar

@saniac Why? The intent is no different @ikostar
@saniac @kalena The biggest killer in human history was Genghis Khan. Would I own a sword of his? Hell yea. The difference? Time and fashion
@saniac @kalena But different things are "meaningful" to dif people. Malleus Malificarum makes me feel sick (literally. I've read it) /
@saniac @kalena / but if someone else wants a copy, that's up to them. It's probably not that important. Compared to being a billionaire say

@ikostar I agree with you 110% on that one
@ikostar @kalena no argument there.
@saniac @kalena /no policies yet. And the level of analysis we get? "He owns a naughty book". Political reporting here is a fucking disgrace
@kalena @ikostar and personal, I agree. Don't think I'm unreasonable or unusual though. Quite possibly wron however.
@saniac A first edition historical text is a pretty tasteful purchase, if you ask me. Anyway, taste is relative @ikostar
@ikostar @kalena I think its a tasteless way to show off.
@kalena @saniac / also a weird amount of projection. How do you know he "went out of his way". How do you know it's not just showing off?
@saniac Please tell me you're joking.
@kalena did you go out of your way to obtain a rare signed copy? If you had, I would find that pretty suss.

tweet: Oh FFS, Mein Kampf is a book. A BOOK! We have a copy on our bookshelf. It's an historical text! How can @KimDotcom be demonized for this?
